nodes.bodyText: The manager always logs that error message even if there are no errors
Updated to only print when errorObject is not empty

it doesn't seem that there is currently a way for the developer to delete existing voice commands. Developers may expect the existing items to be deleted when an empty list is passed but currently, the method just returns in that case. Does iOS have the same behavior?
Updated to allow for an emptylist to be set, added unit test for the updateOperation
This class shouldn't be public
fixed
I suggest wrapping this in a null checking condition
added null check
Do we still need this boolean after using queues? I believe the main reason for using queues is not to use such conditions
removed old HMI Status Logic
In this method (line 141), we are still manually checking HMI and return if it is NONE. That should be handled by pausing and resuming the queues instead.

nodes.bodyText: We shouldn't update voice commands in the case where the devs set the same voice commands as existing ones (iOS implementation has that)
added a check
We don't need to setlastVoiceCommandId again
removed this assignment

currentVoiceCommands shouldn't be updated until we make sure the voiceCommands are successfully sent to the head unit otherwise currentVoiceCommands could have wrong values (if sending the RPC fails for example). Please check how is that implemented in iOS to align with that.
removed this to align with iOS code
I suggest removing the update() method and host its logic directly in setVoiceCommands() because the update() is only called one time and to align more with iOS
removed update method and added to set voice commands
changed to null check
We are setting updateOperation to null twice in this method
removed assignment in the transactionQueue check
I am a little confused about we do we need two variables (this.oldVoiceCommands, this.currentVoiceCommands) if they both point to the same object

If I understand it correctly, we need to keep an updated copy of the current voice commands so we add and remove from currentVoiceCommands based on RPC responses. But since currentVoiceCommands  & oldVoiceCommands  both point to the same object, modifying the first will change the second as well. which makes oldVoiceCommands value incorrect. In that case currentVoiceCommands should be a deep copy of oldVoiceCommands. Because we dont want to alter oldVoiceCommands when we make changes to the items in currentVoiceCommands
changed to copy oldVoiceCommands into currentVoiceCommands

I am not sure what onError() does exactly in Taskmaster, does the queue continue executing other operations? we need to confirm that. Or we can call onFnished() regardless of the RPC response result to let the queue continue
Changed to onFinished() as this is how it was implemented for other tasks such as SoftButtonReplaceOperation and TextAndGraphicUpdateOperation
I suggest doing a null check before updateVoiceCommands just to be extra sure that the object is not null
added null check for listener
updated
We can exit out of the loop when we find the item that we are searching for
change no longer needed due to change in the onResponse methods
We can exit out of the outer loop when we find the item
Updated

in the if (!success) part, we find the request for the corresponding correclationId. Can we just pass that the command id for the request that we found to removeCurrentVoiceCommandWithCorrelationId() instead of passing the correclationId?. that way, we don't have to look for the request again in removeCurrentVoiceCommandWithCorrelationId().
You may need to move the looking for request logic before if..else to use the request in both cases.
If you go with that option please update the name for removeCurrentVoiceCommandWithCorrelationId accordingly
That will make the logic a bit simpler and align with iOS more
All previous comments here also apply to pendingVoiceCommandWithCorrelationId(). The logic can be simplified in a similar manner
Changed as suggested, new method names are removeCurrentVoiceCommandForCorrelatingDeleteCommand and pendingVoiceCommandForCorrelatingAddCommand
updated
You can exit out of the loop when you find the item
change no longer needed with changes to onResponse method

I don't think the list equals method works out of the box for custom objects. I believe you will need to override hashCode() and equals() in VoiceCommand to make the list.equals() method work. you can check SoftButtonObject as an example to see how to implement that.
